title: Order Flow Indicator
content:
The indicator displays order flow directly on the chart in real time.

To add and set up the indicator, open the Indicators settings window.


Indicator's settings

Settings

NameDescription
Visual Mode The visual mode setting determines how selections are displayed on the chart

Options:
  • Circles
  • Rectangles
Trades Calculation Mode of the Indicator

Options:
  • Cumulative Trades
  • Separated Trades
Filter Minimum Filter Value
Show Small Trades Determines whether to display trades that do not pass the filter.
Combine Small Trades If enabled, combines trades that did not pass the filter and have the same price.

Visualization

NameDescription
Buys Sets the color of the element representing the buy signal.
Sells Sets the color of the element representing the sell signal.
Font Specifies various settings for the font.
Text Color Sets the color of the label text.
Line Specifies settings for the color, style, and width of the displayed lines.

Properties
NameDescription
Color
Line style
Options:
  • Solid
  • Dash
  • Dot
  • Dash Dot
  • Dash Dot Dot
Width
Border Specifies settings for the color, style, and width of the displayed lines.

Properties
NameDescription
Color
Line style
Options:
  • Solid
  • Dash
  • Dot
  • Dash Dot
  • Dash Dot Dot
Width
Spacing Sets the spacing value between displayed objects.
Size Sets the size of the displayed objects.
Do not show above chart If enabled, does not display elements in the bar rendering area.
Speed Interval Parameter used to calculate the speed of buying and selling activities. It is set in milliseconds. By adjusting this parameter, you can fine-tune the calculation of buying and selling speed to better reflect the current market situation.

Location

NameDescription
Linked to Bar If enabled, drawing of the order flow starts from the last bar, otherwise from the right edge of the chart.
Offset Sets the x-axis offset of the label in pixels.

Alerts

NameDescription
Use alerts Enables or disables the sound notification.
Alert Filter Sets the value at which the alert is triggered.
Alert File This parameter allows users to specify the name of a custom audio file for alert sounds. Users can select a WAV file that will be played whenever an alert condition is triggered. The chosen WAV file should be located in the folder C:\Program Files (x86)\ATAS Platform\Sounds.
Background Sets the background color of the alert window.
